intro: Atropatenia zangezurica, commonly known as the Zangezur bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine pubescence. Atropatenia zangezurica is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
